description: Pointer events, such as pointerdown, and the PointerEvent API, represent general pointing inputs, from a wide range of devices, such as a mouse, pen or stylus, or touch with one or more fingers. Not to be confused with the pointer-events CSS property.
description_html: Pointer events, such as pointerdown, and the PointerEvent API, represent general pointing inputs, from a wide range of devices, such as a mouse, pen or stylus, or touch with one or more fingers. Not to be confused with the pointer-events CSS property.
name: Pointer Events

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 82, setPointerCapture() throws InvalidPointerId for an invalid pointerId argument. From Firefox 82, it throws the specified NotFoundError exception. See bug 1662124.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox 82, setPointerCapture() throws InvalidPointerId for an invalid pointerId argument. From Firefox 82, it throws the specified NotFoundError exception. See bug 1662124.
The method always returns an empty array, regardless of the user's actions.

ie.notes: Returns values in screen pixels instead of CSS document pixels.
Returns an integer enumeration instead of a string.

chrome.notes: movementX and movementY are not fractional, see bug 41364801.

ie.notes: Returns 0 instead of 0.5 on hardware that doesn't support pressure.
